# Brasa & Olivo - Premium Restaurant Website

Next.js 14 project with App Router, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Framer Motion for a high-end Mediterranean restaurant.

## ✅ Project Completed

### Tech Stack
- Next.js 14 (App Router)
- TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS
- Framer Motion
- Mobile-first responsive design
- SEO optimized

### Implemented Features

#### 1. Hero Section
- Full-screen hero with parallax effect
- Dual CTA buttons (Reservar/Ver Carta)
- Smooth scroll indicator
- Premium typography

#### 2. Navigation
- Sticky header with glassmorphism
- Smooth scroll to sections
- Mobile hamburger menu
- Animated menu items

#### 3. Experience Section
- Philosophy, Premium Product, Chef profile
- Animated cards with hover effects
- Chef spotlight with awards

#### 4. Menu & Tasting Menus
- 6 featured dishes with images
- 3 tasting menus
- Tab navigation
- Price display

#### 5. Gallery
- Masonry grid layout
- 7+ high-quality images
- Hover zoom effects
- Instagram integration

#### 6. Reservations
- Complete booking form
- WhatsApp direct integration
- Contact information
- Business hours

#### 7. Testimonials
- Customer reviews
- Star ratings
- Multiple platform badges
- Social proof metrics

#### 8. Location
- Google Maps embed
- Transport options
- Address details
- Quick contact links

#### 9. Footer
- Company info
- Social media links
- Quick navigation
- Legal links
- Business hours

#### 10. WhatsApp Button
- Floating action button
- Pulse animation
- Tooltip on hover
- Direct messaging

### Files Structure
```
src/
├── app/
│   ├── layout.tsx (SEO + Metadata)
│   ├── page.tsx (Main page)
│   └── globals.css
└── components/
    ├── Navigation.tsx
    ├── Hero.tsx
    ├── Experience.tsx
    ├── Menu.tsx
    ├── Gallery.tsx
    ├── Reservations.tsx
    ├── Testimonials.tsx
    ├── Location.tsx
    ├── Footer.tsx
    └── WhatsAppButton.tsx
```

### Documentation
- README.md - Complete project documentation
- DEPLOYMENT.md - Vercel deployment guide
- CUSTOMIZATION.md - How to personalize content
- .env.example - Environment variables template

### Development
```bash
npm run dev    # Port 3000
npm run build  # Production build
npm run start  # Production server
```

### Deployment
Ready for Vercel deployment. Push to GitHub and import in Vercel dashboard.

### Performance
- Build size: ~142 KB first load
- Static generation (SSG)
- Optimized images
- Code splitting
- SEO complete
